dt: {bc}to press or beat into a pulp or a flat mass {bc}{sx|crush||}
{bc}to flatten out under pressure or impact
{bc}to proceed with a splashing or squelching sound

et: alteration of Middle English {it}squachen{/it} to crush, annul, from Anglo-French {it}esquacher{/it}, from Old French {it}es-{/it} ex- + {it}quachier{/it} to hide from view, from Vulgar Latin {it}*coacticare{/it} to press together {ma}{mat|cache|}{/ma}
shortdef: to press or beat into a pulp or a flat mass : crush
to flatten out under pressure or impact

dt: {bc}the sudden fall of a heavy soft body or the sound of such a fall
{bc}sweetened citrus fruit juice often served with added soda water
{bc}a singles or doubles game played in a 4-wall court with a long-handled racket and a rubber ball that can be hit off any number of walls

shortdef: something soft and easily crushed; specifically : an unripe pod of peas
the sudden fall of a heavy soft body or the sound of such a fall
with a squash or a squashing sound

dt: {bc}any of various fruits of plants (genus {it}Cucurbita{/it}) of the gourd family widely cultivated as vegetables
{bc}a plant and especially a vine that bears {a_link|squashes} {dx}compare {dxt|summer squash||}, {dxt|winter squash||}{/dx}

et: by shortening & alteration from earlier {it}isquoutersquash{/it}, from Narragansett {it}askútasquash{/it}
shortdef: any of various fruits of plants (genus Cucurbita) of the gourd family widely cultivated as vegetables; also : a plant and especially a vine that bears squashes

dt: {bc}a large black American bug ({it}Anasa tristis{/it} of the family Coreidae) injurious to plants of the gourd family

shortdef: a large black American bug (Anasa tristis of the family Coreidae) injurious to plants of the gourd family

fl: noun, plural in form but singular in construction

dt: {bc}a singles racket game resembling squash played with an inflated ball the size of a tennis ball

shortdef: a singles racket game resembling squash played with an inflated ball the size of a tennis ball

dt.t: {it}Squash up{/it} to make room for one more person.

dt: {bc}an acorn-shaped dark green winter squash ({it}Cucurbita pepo{/it}) with a ridged surface and mildly sweet yellow to orange flesh

shortdef: an acorn-shaped dark green winter squash (Cucurbita pepo) with a ridged surface and mildly sweet yellow to orange flesh

dt: {bc}a smooth somewhat bottle-shaped buff-colored winter squash ({it}Cucurbita moschata{/it}) with usually orange flesh

shortdef: a smooth somewhat bottle-shaped buff-colored winter squash (Cucurbita moschata) with usually orange flesh
